item.title: Durga leaves as Chattogram weeps farewell
item.description: The Durga Puja festival which began on Shashthi with the awakening of Anandamayi has drawn to a close on Dashami, as devotees bid farewell to the goddess with the solemn ritual of "mirror immersion". On Thursday morning, after the Bijoya Dashami prayers were completed, worshippers offered flowers

item.title: BYSA announces protest rally against Israeli attack on Sumud flotilla
item.description: Bangladesh Youth Synergy Alliance (BYSA) has announced a protest rally condemning the Israeli attack on the Sumud flotilla and the ongoing genocide in Palestine. The rally will be held at 3pm on Friday at Manik Mia Avenue in the capital, UNB reports. In a statement, BYSA said, “We dem

item.title: Equal status for nurses is vital for Bangladesh’s healthcare: Farhad Mazhar
item.description: Poet and political thinker Farhad Mazhar has demanded that nurses be granted equal professional status to doctors, alongside the immediate formation of a “National Nurse Commission” to ensure health services for the people. Speaking at the Zahur Hossain Chowdhury Hall of the National P

item.title: UN says Israel's action widens unlawful blockade
item.description: Israel's interception in international waters of civilian aid vessels bound for Gaza widens its unlawful blockade of the strip, the U.N. rights office said on Thursday. "As the occupying power, Israel must ensure food and medical supplies for the population to the fullest extent of the means avail

item.title: Israel blocks the main road to Gaza City
item.description: Israeli tanks blocked the main road to Gaza City on Thursday, preventing those who have left the besieged city from returning. Defence Minister Israel Katz said it was now the last chance for hundreds of thousands of people still inside to escape. Israel has told the entire million-strong p

item.title: Bangladesh student group expresses solidarity with Sumud flotilla
item.description: The Bangladesh Ganatantrik Chhatra Sansad (BAGCHAS) held a rally at Dhaka University on Thursday afternoon to express solidarity with the Global Sumud Flotilla, which was mostly intercepted by Israel. Titled ‘Sumud: Steadfast,’ the program emphasized Palestinians’ right to self-d

item.title: Gas pressure disruption hits Gazipur factories
item.description: Gas pressure has dropped in parts of the Gazipur zone under Titas Gas Transmission and Distribution Company Limited, disrupting production at garment factories and textile mills, industry insiders said. Titas officials said a fire broke out in a gas line near Chandra intersection on the Dhaka&ndas

item.title: Nagorik Oikya’s Manna promises not to object if NCP secures ‘Shapla’ symbol
item.description: Nagorik Oikya Convenor Mahmudur Rahman Manna has promised not to object if the Election Commission allocates the “Shapla” symbol to the National Citizen Party. Both the Nagorik Oikya and NCP sought the Shapla symbol during their registration process. But the EC has refused, saying Shap

item.title: EC rules out ‘Water Lily’ for NCP, asks it to pick from 50 electoral symbols
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) has sent a letter to the National Citizen Party (NCP) attaching a list of 50 electoral symbols, asking the party to pick one from the list instead of its desired ‘Water Lily’ symbol. “The National Citizen Party-NCP in its application mentioned ‘
